p: The fruits of Piper nigrum were collected from the local market of muzaffarnagar district, Uttar Pradesh, India. The collected fruits were identified by Dr. Sunita Garg, Emeritus Scientist, CSIR- National Institute of Science Communication & International resources, Pusa, New Delhi-110012 India. The voucher specimen (NISCAIR/RHMD/Consult/2019/3427-28-2) have been deposited in the Raw Materials Herbarium & Museum (RHMD), Delhi, India. For the extraction of essential oils from fruits of Piper nigrum, powdered material was hydrodistilled for 4 h in a Clevenger type of apparatus to yield 1.4% transparent essential oil (PNEO) with a characteristic odor. The oil was dried over anhydrous Na 2SO 4 and placed in a refrigerator at 4 Â°C before the chemical and neuropharmacological analysis.
